trans-unit.source: Separate Application Insights resources for dev, test and production
trans-unit.target: Separate Application Insights resources for dev, test and production

trans-unit.source: Monitor the performance and usage of your application at different stages of development
trans-unit.target: Monitor the performance and usage of your application at different stages of development

trans-unit.source: To avoid mixing up telemetry from debugging, test, and production versions of your app, create separate <linkText>Application Insights[start]</linkText><title></title> resources to receive the data from each version.
trans-unit.target: To avoid mixing up telemetry from debugging, test, and production versions of your app, create separate <linkText>Application Insights[start]</linkText><title></title> resources to receive the data from each version.

trans-unit.source: The data received from your application is stored and processed by Application Insights in a Microsoft Azure resource.
trans-unit.target: The data received from your application is stored and processed by Application Insights in a Microsoft Azure resource.

trans-unit.source: Each resource is identified by an instrumentation key. In your app, the key is provided to the Application Insights SDK so that it can send the data it collects to the right resource.
trans-unit.target: Each resource is identified by an instrumentation key. In your app, the key is provided to the Application Insights SDK so that it can send the data it collects to the right resource.

trans-unit.source: The key can be provided either in code or in ApplicationInsights.config.
trans-unit.target: The key can be provided either in code or in ApplicationInsights.config.

trans-unit.source: By changing the key in the SDK, you can direct data to different resources.
trans-unit.target: By changing the key in the SDK, you can direct data to different resources.

trans-unit.source: In the <linkText>portal.azure.com</linkText><title></title>, add an Application Insights resource:
trans-unit.target: In the <linkText>portal.azure.com</linkText><title></title>, add an Application Insights resource:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click New, Application Insights</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click New, Application Insights</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Application type affects what you see on the overview blade and the properties available in metric explorer[metrics].
trans-unit.target: Application type affects what you see on the overview blade and the properties available in metric explorer[metrics].

trans-unit.source: If you don't see your type of app, choose one of the web types for web pages, and one of the phone types for other devices.
trans-unit.target: If you don't see your type of app, choose one of the web types for web pages, and one of the phone types for other devices.

trans-unit.source: Resource group is a convenience for managing properties like access control.
trans-unit.target: Resource group is a convenience for managing properties like access control.

trans-unit.source: You could use separate resource groups for development, test, and production.
trans-unit.target: You could use separate resource groups for development, test, and production.

trans-unit.source: Subscription is your payment account in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Subscription is your payment account in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Location is where we keep your data.
trans-unit.target: Location is where we keep your data.

trans-unit.source: Currently it can't be changed.
trans-unit.target: Currently it can't be changed.

trans-unit.source: Add to startboard puts a quick-access tile for your resource on your Azure Home page.
trans-unit.target: Add to startboard puts a quick-access tile for your resource on your Azure Home page.

trans-unit.source: Creating the resource takes a few seconds.
trans-unit.target: Creating the resource takes a few seconds.

trans-unit.source: You'll see an alert when it's done.
trans-unit.target: You'll see an alert when it's done.

trans-unit.source: (You can write a <linkText>PowerShell script</linkText><title></title> to create a resource automatically.)
trans-unit.target: (You can write a <linkText>PowerShell script</linkText><title></title> to create a resource automatically.)

trans-unit.source: The instrumentation key identifies the resource that you created.
trans-unit.target: The instrumentation key identifies the resource that you created.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Click Essentials, click the Instrumentation Key, CTRL+C</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Click Essentials, click the Instrumentation Key, CTRL+C</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You'll need the instrumentation keys of all the resources to which your app will send data.
trans-unit.target: You'll need the instrumentation keys of all the resources to which your app will send data.

trans-unit.source: Usually the SDK gets the iKey from ApplicationInsights.config.
trans-unit.target: Usually the SDK gets the iKey from ApplicationInsights.config.

trans-unit.source: Instead, make it more easy to change by setting it in your code.
trans-unit.target: Instead, make it more easy to change by setting it in your code.

trans-unit.source: Set the key in an initialization method, such as global.aspx.cs in an ASP.NET service:
trans-unit.target: Set the key in an initialization method, such as global.aspx.cs in an ASP.NET service:

trans-unit.source: C#
trans-unit.target: C#

trans-unit.source: In this example, the ikeys for the different resources are placed in different versions of the web configuration file.
trans-unit.target: In this example, the ikeys for the different resources are placed in different versions of the web configuration file.

trans-unit.source: Swapping the web configuration file will swap the target resource.
trans-unit.target: Swapping the web configuration file will swap the target resource.

trans-unit.source: The iKey is also used in your app's web pages, in the <linkText>script that you got from the quick start blade</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: The iKey is also used in your app's web pages, in the <linkText>script that you got from the quick start blade</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Instead of coding it literally into the script, generate it from the server state.
trans-unit.target: Instead of coding it literally into the script, generate it from the server state.

trans-unit.source: For example, in an ASP.NET app:
trans-unit.target: For example, in an ASP.NET app:

trans-unit.source: JavaScript in Razor
trans-unit.target: JavaScript in Razor
